eecs2311.project

Class SimulatorTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • eecs2311.project.SimulatorTest

  • public class SimulatorTest
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a JUnit test class for Simulator class.
    Author:
    Team 4: Yassin Mohamed, Qassim Allauddin, Derek Li, Artem Solovey.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      org.junit.rules.ExpectedException exceptionRule
      The ExpectedException rule allows you to verify that your code throws a specific exception.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SimulatorTest() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void setUp()
      Is executed before every test, sets up the two Simulators to be tested.
      static void setUpBeforeClass() 
      void testClearAllCells()
      Tests the clearAllCells() method, calling it then checking that all the radio buttons in all the cells that are instantiated in the Simulator are not selected.
      void testDisplayString()
      Tests the displayString() method, passing a string and checking that the correct braille cells are displaying the correct character in the string.
      void testGetButton()
      Test the getButton() method, checking that the one button that was initialized is returned when the method is called with the correct index passed, and checking that the method throws the correct exceptions when an incorrect index is passed.
      void testGetCell()
      Tests the getCell() method, checking that the reference to the cell is returned when the method is called and the correct index is passed, and checking that the method throws the correct exceptions if the index that was passed was invalid.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • exceptionRule

        public org.junit.rules.ExpectedException exceptionRule
        The ExpectedException rule allows you to verify that your code throws a specific exception. We initialize it to expect no exceptions to be thrown yet.

        public static void setUpBeforeClass()
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setUp

        public void setUp()
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Is executed before every test, sets up the two Simulators to be tested.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • testGetButton

        public void testGetButton()
        Test the getButton() method, checking that the one button that was initialized is returned when the method is called with the correct index passed, and checking that the method throws the correct exceptions when an incorrect index is passed.

      • testGetCell

        public void testGetCell()
        Tests the getCell() method, checking that the reference to the cell is returned when the method is called and the correct index is passed, and checking that the method throws the correct exceptions if the index that was passed was invalid.

      • testClearAllCells

        public void testClearAllCells()
        Tests the clearAllCells() method, calling it then checking that all the radio buttons in all the cells that are instantiated in the Simulator are not selected.

      • testDisplayString

        public void testDisplayString()
        Tests the displayString() method, passing a string and checking that the correct braille cells are displaying the correct character in the string.
